resources.string: O deck ainda não contém cartas
Área de transferência não contém texto
Mover o cartão para outro deck
Copie o cartão para outro deck
Esta configuração é usada por estes baralhos:
Se você excluir essa configuração, será utilizada em seu lugar a configuração padrão. Você realmente quer excluir esta configuração?
Selecione os idiomas das questões e respostas para poder pronunciar a fala corretamente.

A pronúncia é feita através do Android TTS API. Se você deseja personalizar a síntese de fala com mais detalhe, por exemplo, mudar o mecanismo de, voz, timbre de voz, taxa de fala, basta acessar as configurações de TTS.
É altamente recomendável permitir a fala automática em linguas estrangeiras. Para que você vai entenda como as palavras devem soar. Isso pode ajudá-lo a memorizar informações mais rapidamente.
Para fazer um pedaço de texto ser pronunciado, simplesmente o selecione e clique no ícone \'Falar\'.

A \'fala de textos entre parênteses\' está desligada, é fácil separar o texto que deve ser pronunciado do texto que não deve. Use os colchetes () [] {} <> para isso. Por exemplo, coloque as transcrições, sinônimos, definições neles.
Ir para as configurações de TTS
Seu dispositivo não tem configurações de TTS
Inverta os cartões se as respostas podem parecer perguntas, e vice-versa. Por exemplo, isso pode ser aplicado aos cartões de \'tradução de idiomas\'.
Supostamente se você ocultar o texto de uma pergunta, você vai perceber a pergunta ouvindo. Pode ser uma boa contribuição para melhorar suas habilidades de escuta enquanto aprende um idioma.
Como você desativou a \'exibição de perguntas\', você receber a pergunta oralmente. Então, não se esqueça de habilitar a \'fala automática\' da pergunta para tornar o exercício mais confortável.
\'Sem teste\' é adequado para as vezes que você planeja rodar os cartões uma ou duas vezes.
Na maioria dos casos, \'Auto teste\' é a melhor escolha. É você quem decide se sabe a resposta ou não.
\'Testando com variantes\' é um método de teste mais reproduzível. Você seleciona a resposta certa dentre quatro variantes. As variantes são extraídas do mesmo deck.
Com \'Verificação ortográfica\', será verificado se a resposta que você digitou corresponde à resposta real. Adequado se a ortografia é importante para você.
Com repetição espaçada, as informações ou conhecimentos ficarão ainda mais enraizados na sua memória de longo prazo.
Ajuste o esquema de intervalos para atender a você. Princípio geral: \'Quanto maior a dificuldade, mais longo o intervalo deve ser\'.
Indica como você deseja que as respostas sejam avaliadas.
As notas determinam qual intervalo deve passar depois da resposta no exercício.
Se você especificar uma nota manualmente, este esquema de avaliação não será aplicado ao cartão durante o exercício.
Em resposta correta de cartão repetido
\'Temporizador Motivacional\" projetado para te impedir de se distrair. Se não responder dentro do tempo previsto, você será penalizado com a pergunta marcada como errada.
Ponha tempo suficiente para responder à pergunta sem se preocupar com a contagem regressiva. Se você sentir que precisa de mais tempo pode parar o temporizador.
o número deve ser\nmaior que zero
Você alterou a configuração do temporizador de \'%1$s\' para \'%2$s\'. Deseja salvar as alterações?
Describe how you want the card to be pronounced in \'Card player\'.

Try to answer the question in your head before it is pronounced. If you need more time to respond, just increase delay between speaking question and answer. For example, the translation of a sentence may take 5 or more seconds.
If you have just started learning a language, set up a pronunciation plan so that foreign speech is spoken twice.
How a card looks in the exercise, player and editor
Filtering cards before starting the exercise
Show the card filter when the number of cards is greater than %d
Specify the maximum number of cards you want to handle in the exercise at once.
Specify the card limit above which the card filter will be displayed.
Go to the next card after marking the card as \'Learned\'
Ask to quit exercise if not all cards are answered
Rate the app on Google Play

App rating affect people\'s decision to download app. Positive rating can help us reach more users. With higher downloads, we will be able to receive feedback from a number of different perspectives which will help us in making ForgetMeNot better than ever.
Tell us what\'s working, and what\'s not. We want to provide you with the best experience, so your feedback is very valuable. Let us know how we can do better.
Translation is necessary for users who speak others languages to enjoy the app. Also, localization enables the app to be more accessible and useful to a wider audience.
Your friends might need the app. Share your experience with them.
Get the latest news, share interesting articles, ask questions. Connect, follow and have conversation with us.
ForgetMeNot can import text files in two formats:

Q: 
What city was the first capital of the United States? 
A: 
New York City




Q: 
Who first discovered America? 
A: 
Leif Erikson




Q: 
Who invented the first car? 
A: 
Karl Benz




Q: 
When did the Revolutionary War end? 
A: 
September 3, 1783

This is a proprietary format of ForgetMeNot. It was invented for manually creating cards in a text file. This format is intuitive and readable. It is recommended to use this format if you compose cards on a computer.

"nature";"природа" 
"beach";"берег, пляж" 
"coast";"морское побережье" 
"desert";"пустыня" 
"glacier";"ледник" 
"forest";"лес" 
"field";"поле, луг" 
"canyon";"каньон" 
"island";"остров" 
"jungle";"джунгли, дебри" 
"lake";"озеро" 
"mountain";"гора" 
"hill";"холм, возвышенность" 
"plain";"равнина" 
"hollow";"низина, впадина" 
"pond";"пруд" 
"rock";"скала, камень" 
"ocean";"океан" 
"sea";"море" 
"river";"река"

This is the generic name for CSV or TSV files. This format is used to represent tabular data. Many programs such as Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets allow you to export data in this format. ForgetMeNot interpret each record (row) as a separate card, the first column as a question, the second column as an answer. You can also manually create such files. For example, create a file with a .tsv extension where the tab character will separate questions and answers.
\n\nSince this format is not strict, you are invited to choose a clarifying format among the predefined ones or create your own.

In the exercise, you should answer questions. For each deck, you can specify unique settings, which can significantly change the examination manner:


	- show cards in random order or not (Random order) 

	- how to check the answer (Testing method) 

	- present the question visually or orally (Question display, Pronunciation) 

	- whether to pronounce question or answer automatically (Pronunciation) 

	- whether it is necessary to exchange the question and the answer. Of course, it might be needed if they are interchangeable. (Card Inversion) 

	- is there a time limit for response (Motivational timer)


Regardless of testing method, the answer may be either correct or wrong. If the answer is wrong, the card will be asked again until the answer is correct. It is needed in order to make sure that you commit the answer to memory.

Your answers influence the grade of the card. If intervals are enabled, the grade determines when the card will be asked again.
\n\nIf you know the question well and you don\'t want this card ever to be asked again or you don\'t want to study the card, click the \'Mark as learned\' icon. This card will never be asked again.

You can edit the card just in the exercise. It might be needed not only for correcting mistakes on the card, but also for improving the card if it is difficult to remember. You may also use search if you confused answers.


There are two types of hints available in the exercise:


	- 'Mask letters'. This hint can be applied many times. The first time you turn to the hint, all letters will be replaced with a masked character ■. You can see how many words are in the answer, how many letters are in each word. If this is not enough, you can unmask part of the answer. Just select a fragment and press 'Unmask selected region' on hint popup window.


	- 'Get variants'. Four variants will be provided to choose. The variants are taken from the deck to which the card belongs. This hint can make it a lot easier to answer if the deck is not designed for 'Testing method with variants'.
You can also do the exercise without looking at the screen in \'Walking mode\'.
Testing methods define how the answer will be tested. There are 4 options:
Всі діти в цьому класі дуже ввічливі.
All the children in this class are very polite.

It may be used for decks with which you do not plan to work for a long time. For example, it might be a deck that contains sentences in the native and target language and you want to translate once without further repetition.
[maɪm]\n\nuse gesture and movement without words in the acting of a play or role
Basic testing method. You decide whether you remember the answer or not. The main advantage is the efficiency of memorization.

In this mode, you need to choose the correct variant from the four offered. Variants are taken from the deck to which the card belongs. Therefore, if you are going to use this testing method, it is important to create a deck where variants are appropriate. For example, it could be a \'word-translation\' deck with the same parts of speech. This is a more playful form of testing, so it\'s great for kids. The disadvantage is the average memory efficiency, as variants are an significant clue.

This method will be useful if you want to test the spelling of words. It can be used as a dictation. To do this, create a deck where the question and answer will be the same, turn off the question display, select the language and enable the auto-pronunciation of the question in the deck settings.

Each card is characterized by the grade. Each answer in the exercise affects the grade according to the 'Grading' settings. You can configure how the answers should be graded in the deck settings. By default, the grades are changed in the following way:


	- decreases by one for each wrong answer, but not less than zero


	- increases by one with the correct answer, but only if the card is answered for the first time in this exercise session


	- does not change if the answer is correct, but this card was sent for retesting, due to an incorrect answer the previous time

The grade is directly related to intervals, which are applied to the deck. The intervals affect when the card is available for the exercise next time after responding. Usually, the higher the grade, the longer the interval. That is, the intervals are needed so that you deal more with poorly-studied cards and less with well-studied ones.
\n\nPerhaps, for some reason, you want to change the grade. Just tap on the \'Grade\' icon and choose the one you want. Usually, when you change the grade, you would like to clarify how long it will take to be this card questioned again. If you manually changed the grade, the standard scheme would not apply to this card for this exercise session.

You can turn off the question display. In this case, it is supposed that you will get the question via voice playback. This will help improve your listening skills when learning a foreign language. Together with this, it is appropriate to enable the automatic pronunciation of the question. If you still want to see the question, just click on \'Show question\'.
Je demande à voir un avocat!
I demand to see an avocado!

\'Motivational timer\' designed to focus your attention on learning. If it is on, then you have some time to answer the question. If you miss the deadline, the card is considered as expired, and the answer is automatically marked as incorrect. If you have set enough time to respond, then the reason for expiring the card is that you have lost concentration, and the motivational timer will act as a reminder of this. If you are thinking of the answer and feel that you don\'t have enough time, tap on \'Stop\' on timer popup window to stop the timer.
How much is 0.0193 km in decimetres?

This app supports the pronunciation of text through Text-to-speech API provided by Android OS. For each deck, you can choose the language in which to pronounce the question, and the language in which to pronounce the answer. Therefore, it is important to use one language for questions and one language for answers when creating a deck. If you want to have cards with different languages of questions and answers, then you need to create separate decks. It is recommended to always indicate languages.


You can also choose to automatically pronounce the question or answer. This is always useful when learning languages.


If 'Speak text in brackets' is disabled, then the application will not speak the text framed in brackets () {} [] <>. So you can add any additional information in brackets, for example, transcription of words, synonyms, words with which you often confuse translation.


To pronounce some part of the text, just highlight it and click the pronunciation icon.

'Walking mode' is a special mode of exercise where you can answer questions without looking at the screen. Control is carried out using gestures of the volume buttons. Each action is accompanied with pronunciation, for example, when you go to the next card, a question will be pronounced, when you answer (remember/not remember), the answer will be pronounced.


This mode can be used when you walk to somewhere and you want to make good use of time. That's where it got its name from.


⚠️ Precautions:


- the screen must be keep on. This is due to the Android operating system: applications can use the volume keys only when it is in the foreground.


- Methods 'Testing with variants' and 'Spell check' are inappropriate to use in this mode and therefore forcibly switch to the 'Self testing'.


- auto-pronunciation of questions and answers is turned on. Don't forget to specify the correct languages ​​in the deck pronunciation settings.


- 'Motivational timer' is turned off.

Autoplaying cards is a mode in which questions and answers are pronounced in turn. It can be compared to an audio player, but instead of tracks, questions and answers are played. This mode is suitable when you are doing something, but could listen simultaneously, for example, when preparing food.
\n\nFor each deck, you can customize the pronunciation plan. For example, to pronounce a question twice, or to increase the interval between question and answer so that you have enough time to remember the answer before you hear it.

Preset is a set of controls created in advance that can be reused. Presets are needed to avoid the routine of settings decks.


What preset names mean:


	Default - standard unchangeable settings.


	Individual - no preset is applied.


	'Your preset name' - a saved preset that can be shared. Any change of this preset will affect each deck to which it is applied.

1. Try to keep your cards as short as possible. It is better to create several than to put everything into one. For example, if you create a card for memorizing a foreign word, then it should describe only one interpretation of it, which can be expressed in no more than 3 words. You can add additional information in parentheses, but the answer itself should be short.


2. Create decks taking into account the settings that you are going to apply to them.


	- For testing method 'Testing with variants', variants are taken from the same deck. Therefore, the cards should contain answers that fit to be variants.


	- In the pronunciation settings of a deck, you can specify a language for questions and another language for answers. Therefore, you need to create deck where one language is used for questions, and also one language is used for answers.


	- If you want to use 'Card inversion', then create such a card so that an answer can look like a question.


3. If you are creating the deck as a file on your computer, you can download this template file. All you need to do is replace 'question' with your question and 'answer' with your answer. Use Copy/Paste to speed up composing. If you are creating a deck on your Android device, try to use multi-window mode.


4. Think of the deck compiling as part of the learning process. Try to remember everything on the fly.

1. Don't memorize an answer word for word. The main thing is that you have an understanding of the answer. Always visualize the question being asked.


2. If you are learning a foreign language, speak answers aloud. This will help you not only to pronounce words correctly, but also to focus on your studies.


3. Use tools that help you focus on your studies. Use 'Motivational timer', turn on full screen mode, activate the 'Do not disturb' mode in the device settings.


4. If the question is bad for you to remember, edit the card, rephrase the question, remove the unnecessary in the answer. If you got the answers mixed up, use the search and find the confusing card.


5. Make it a rule that once a day you should not have any tasks left to study.
You don\'t have any e-mail client to compose mail
You don\'t have any browser to open URL

ForgetMeNot is designed to memorize information. It based on spaced repetition of flashcards. The app supports speech output, import cards from file, unique settings of each deck and many other interesting features. Besides traditional examination of the knowledge, there is also the autoplaying mode. ForgetMeNot is a great thing for language learning and not only.

More than a year ago, when I started learning a foreign language, I decided to use flashcards to memorize words. Having tried dozens of different apps on Google Play, none of them satisfied me completely. So I decided to create my own one.


First of all, I wanted my application to have a clean UI so that I could fully focus on my studies. My app had to be convenient and super fast so that I could repeat at least 10 words per minute. Also, my requirements included support for spaced repetitions, pronunciation, importing cards from a file (because a deck can be created on a computer quite quickly using copy-paste).


After implementing the pronunciation, I realized that with this, I can greatly expand the possibilities of the learning process. First, I can hide the text of the question to perceive the text not visually, but aurally. It would be a good contributor to improving my listening skills. Second, during some activities, I could repeat the material at the same time, if the application could switch cards itself. Third, (it's somewhat unusual function) I could answer the questions when I walk somewhere, not looking at the screen by controlling the application with the volume buttons. Well it's done.


Furthermore, I implemented some simple but important features, for example, editing card on the go, card reversing, reusing deck settings and many others. There are also additional options to help you focus on your studies, such as 'Full Screen Mode' and 'Motivational timer'.


Am I satisfied with the program now? Not exactly. There are a few more ideas for improvement. But I think that at this stage it looks quite attractive and can suit many people who study languages and not only.


I am not in any way pursuing commercial goals. My app is completely free and open source. I'd like to know what you think about my app!
I would like to express my deep gratitude to everyone (especially the people from sekinfo.org), who support the project by providing translation. You’re the best!

Delimiter-separated values are processed with the Apache Commons CSV library. Visit this page to learn more about format settings.


Special characters: 
	\n - new line 
	\r - carriage return 
	\t - horizontal tab
